chapter_title: LAW 35 - MASTER THE ART OF TIMING
summary: Mastering the art of timing is crucial for achieving power and success. Patience is key; you must learn to wait for the right moment while displaying self-control. History shows us that those who act impulsively often face consequences, whereas those who harness the ebb and flow of time can execute their strategies effectively. From historical figures like Sertorius and Fouché, we learn that timing can determine the rise or fall of individuals. Ultimately, understanding and manipulating the perception of time can lead to greater influence and eventual triumph.

slides.section_body: Never appear rushed, for haste reveals insecurity. Embrace patience, letting the world perceive that time is on your side. This control over your moves establishes authority and composure.
slides.quote: Hurrying betrays a lack of control over yourself and over time.

slides.section_body: Sertorius taught that a well-timed retreat can strengthen resolve. By allowing his men to engage in battle, he taught them the virtue of patience and the power of strategic withdrawal for future victories.
slides.quote: Perseverance is more effective than brute strength.

slides.section_body: Joseph Fouché capitalized on tumultuous times, illustrating that success hinges on one's ability to read and adapt to the changing tides of authority. Timing can mean the difference between supporting an empire or watching it falter.
slides.quote: Power sticks to those who bring it to a conclusion.

slides.section_title: Understand the Spirit of the Times
slides.section_body: Recognize emerging trends that influence public sentiment. By aligning with these currents at the right moment, one can rise to prominence and influence.
slides.quote: Work with the times, anticipate twists, and never miss the boat.

slides.section_body: Master the timing of actions, as social movements often breed powerful counter-reactions. By predicting these shifts, one positions themselves advantageously in the aftermath.
slides.quote: Wait for the tide's ebb to carry you back to power.

slides.section_body: Patience is not passive; it builds strength for future actions. During times of struggle, stealth and discretion can nurture alliances and resources until readiness for decisive action arises.
slides.quote: Without patience, your timing will fail and you will inevitably find yourself a loser.

slides.section_body: Control how time is perceived by others. Those that rush unknowingly make mistakes; by making them wait, you seize opportunities unreachable during haste.
slides.quote: The trick in forcing time is to upset the timing of others.

slides.section_body: Applying pressure and creating urgency on opponents can provoke rash decisions. This manipulation of their time can lead to openings ripe for exploitation.
slides.quote: Set their deadlines for them; never give them time.

slides.section_body: After waiting and strategizing, act swiftly when the moment arises. The combination of patience and decisive action ultimately reflects true mastery over timing.
slides.quote: Patience is worthless unless combined with a willingness to fall ruthlessly on your opponent at the right moment.

slides.section_body: To guide time, you must keep a tight grip on your narrative. Avoid becoming a victim of time's chaos, adapt strategically, and shape outcomes in your favor.
slides.quote: There is no power to be gained in letting go of the reins.
